title: Foundation Space Practice Test
description: Test what you know about shapes and position words!

questions.question: Which shape is perfectly round with no sides and no corners?
questions.explanation: A circle is the only shape that is perfectly round. It has no straight sides and no corners. Think of a coin or a clock face.

questions.question: How many sides does a triangle have?
questions.explanation: A triangle has 3 straight sides and 3 corners. The word 'tri' means three!

questions.question: A shape has 4 sides that are all the same length and 4 corners. What shape is it?
questions.explanation: A square has 4 sides that are all the same length and 4 corners. A rectangle also has 4 sides and 4 corners, but its sides are not all the same length.

questions.question: A cat is sitting below the table. Which position word describes where the cat is?
questions.explanation: If the cat is below the table, it is under the table. 'Under' and 'below' mean the same thing -- the cat is lower than the table.

questions.question: Three books are on a shelf: a red book, a green book, and a blue book. The green book is in the middle. The green book is _____ the red book and the blue book.
questions.explanation: When something is in the middle of two other things, we say it is between them. The green book is between the red book and the blue book.

questions.question: What shape is a door?
questions.explanation: A door has 4 sides and 4 corners. The two tall sides are longer than the top and bottom, which makes it a rectangle.

questions.question: How many corners does a square have?
questions.explanation: A square has 4 corners. Corners are where two sides meet. A square has 4 sides that meet at 4 corners.

questions.question: What shape has 3 sides and 3 corners?
questions.explanation: A triangle is the shape with 3 sides and 3 corners. 'Tri' means three!

questions.question: A bird is sitting on top of a fence. Is the bird above or below the fence?
questions.explanation: If the bird is sitting on top of the fence, it is above the fence. 'On top of' and 'above' describe something that is higher.

questions.question: How many sides does a circle have?
questions.explanation: A circle has no straight sides -- it is perfectly round and curved. That is what makes it different from all the other shapes we learned.
